description: From Ancient Greek ψυχή (psukhḗ, “mind, soul”) + δῆλος (dêlos, “manifest, visible”) + -ic. Coined by English psychiatrist Humphry Osmond in 1956 in a letter to Aldous Huxley.

adjectives.description: psychedelic (comparative more psychedelic, superlative most psychedelic)

entries.meaning: Of, containing, generating, or reminiscent of drug-induced hallucinations, distortions of perception, altered awareness etc.
(of graphics, etc.) Having bright colours, abstract shapes, etc. reminiscent of drug-induced hallucinations or distortions of perception.

Any psychoactive substance (such as LSD or psilocybin) which, when consumed, causes perceptual changes (sometimes erratic and uncontrollable), visual hallucination, and altered awareness of the body and mind.
examples: I was going to become a three-drug connection to all my friends, psychedelics, hash and pot.
